item.title: Hangzhou, Two Days, Some Old Stories
item.author: contact@yfreetime.com (Danny Yuan)
item.description:
I’m recording this weekend in Hangzhou.

The last time I was here was a year ago for interviews. Before that, I have to go back to 2017. I left a company in Hangzhou for Beijing because the internet opportunities I wanted were there. Even earlier, in 2015, I did a summer internship in Beijing and experienced the subway crush. I rented a windowless room in Beiyuan for 1,500 RMB a month; with the light off, day and night were the same. I remember thinking: I probably won’t work for a Beijing company again. The city felt too harsh.

item.title: 2024 Year-End Review
item.author: contact@yfreetime.com (Danny Yuan)
item.description:
About the Internet and Blogging

I don’t think I’ve ever documented a year through public writing. Over the past two years, I talked about the “cliche” stories of yesterday, today, and tomorrow via podcast—usually by extracting a few keywords and expanding on them with experiences and reflections. It felt a bit like an essay prompt, but it made year‑end review easier to finish. Still, podcasts are ultimately for entertainment, because the show is made for others.
